87EF07DD16974FF58B1E547887CD5ECE.description:
Discusses appropriate interactions between students, teammates, coaches, officials, 
administrators, and parents as it relates to the team sports.

EF5249D76BA9492D99D27B5C248E48A0.description:
Formulates ideas regarding how strategies, tactics, and participation as an individual and 
player in team sports can be a form of self-expression

E30B2F00A2114034A166244C42C2E056.description:
Differentiates how exercise can positively affect psychological fitness and sociological 
interactions

DAE401DB091846C6AA868B2A4C704E88.description:
Investigates how learning a team sport provides confidence in physical skills that can lead 
to better social interaction and participation in sport throughout one’s life.

5210882BD2E74522B30DD047708B94F3.description: Compares the health benefits of participation in life-long team sports and games.

1F3088B74628449E8BBFECCB9A1F6210.description:
Assesses the value of a physically active lifestyle as it relates to high school, college, and 
career productivity

EE91FE0F61904C2B873B3D5BEA209A1D.description: The physically educated student recognizes the value of physical activity for health, enjoyment, challenge, self-expression, and/or social interaction.

954E0FF2C4744ED396A6365AE0BD25AB.description:
Discusses appropriate responses to success, failure, sportsmanship, conflict, and teammate 
encouragement as it relates to participation in team sports.

6528C2918BBC4A01B6A707020FE0B49E.description: Applies safe practices in physical education setting.

F3D432450C65495496313830400C1745.description: Uses communication skills to promote positive team building group dynamics

407BE78ACAB24100911123299B6FDA70.description: Exhibits proper etiquette, respect for others, and teamwork in given team sport.

7FBF413236A34699A8D46A519AF832EB.description: Identifies and follows the rules of each team sport and game.

BE50A348C8744EBFA361AEDD8FB98AAD.description: Applies safe practices in physical education settings.

4A63C79E310D4AA69F520F7BF3DD7ED7.description:
Becomes a problem solver and remains impartial when communicating and coming to a 
decision regarding a strategy, tactic, principle, concept, or ruling during an activity or game.

9BDD0D54D81F45678CA2E66FD2FAA123.description: Uses communication skills to promote positive team building group dynamic

9F3D6C232C474DFBAAB431A85C784E88.description: Identifies the difference between taunting and celebrating as it relates to sportsmanship

07610CC6445C415DBF4924FCE3513F0F.description: The physically educated student exhibits responsible personal and social behavior that respects self and others in physical activity settings.

08442A87E593419F8E428620E9AB47A4.description:
Discusses risks and safety factors that affect physical activity levels in team sports in heat, 
humidity, and cold.

6B1E7515708944578251A929101935EE.description:
Compares and contrasts the flexibility needed when competing in at least one invasion 
game, one net game, and one striking game

6DE519DC8E2649699FDC977E2F50034F.description:
Compares and contrasts the muscular power needed when competing in at least one 
invasion game, one net game, and one striking game

83902CA745FC4AB5A0D75B6C1F86C71D.description:
Compares and contrasts the muscular endurance needed when competing in at least one 
invasion game, one net game, and one striking game

B88E5CF4A745476681D7BFD0247FD7D9.description:
Compares and contrasts the level of physical exertion (e.g., vigorous, moderate, and low) 
between at least one invasion game, one net game, and one striking game.

42ADE6A6F5514D49BBA06C1D93D2A0C4.description:
Compares and contrasts the cardiovascular benefit of participating in physical activities 
between at least one invasion game, one net game, and one striking game.

0268CF9A7CBD43A9BE1C820C20B174EC.description: The physically educated student demonstrates knowledge and skills to help achieve and maintain a health-enhancing level of physical activity and fitness.

8C137F34D49A42E1823F46C2FB6AE311.description:
Enacts set plays, strategies and tactics for at least one invasion game, one net game, and 
one striking game.

5ED87DB0DF7044488E223DF2A3F42116.description:
Employs defensive strategies and tactics enacted by individual students, small group, and 
the whole team in at least one invasion game, one net game, and one striking game.

0FFF686EE0E04128ADEB5C691F321E1A.description:
Employs offensive strategies and tactics enacted by individual students, small group, and 
the whole team in at least one invasion game, one net game, and one striking game

FC37A2E0396E4C2F8A68450A21AFA8F6.description:
Applies motor skills and movement patterns for creating space and defensive play to 
prevent offensive advancements and scoring in at least one invasion game, one net game, and one striking game.

FB4CF31A27C64E28A6712BDE576AB8B5.description:
Applies a sequence of motor skills and movement patterns for creating space and 
offensive advancements and scoring in general and in individual space in at least one invasion game, one net game, and one striking game

DF07270F7F6A43A7B7D0E184F35048CA.description:
Applies sequences of motor skills and movement patterns of body position, movement in 
general space, use of manipulates, and use of force/motion/rotation in least one invasion game, one net game, and one striking game.

9146F74079984EB4AC2431F132174EED.description:
Applies the principles and concepts of offensive and defensive player positions and 
applies the appropriate positioning to game situations in at least one invasion game, one net game, and one striking game

4BABE2CA8DA3453490F2D7186A29D286.description:
Applies the principles and concepts of safety, rules, equipment, and warm-up/cool-down 
procedures for at least one invasion game, one net game, and one striking game.

7BF1871B38E14AF3981E676ED96F88A7.description: The physically educated student applies the knowledge of concepts, principles, strategies, and tactics related to movement and performance.

1238B705DD124439860791FE2C27DF04.description:
Explains how muscles are used in a basic, sport-specific motion utilized in an invasion, 
net, or striking game or sport in order for a person to participate.

358F5E4489DE4E548B9105F06DDD1139.description:
Compares and contrasts the basic muscle groups, bones, and joints used in motor skills 
and movement patterns for at least one invasion game, one net game, and one striking game

53663850CE5141E4A42E2CC25D3A614E.description: Chooses and employs the appropriate motor skills and movement patterns needed to participate in sports and games involving striking with long and/or short handled implements.

C3C46B2132EB44909FF1D2356D216BA1.description:
Chooses and employs the appropriate motor skills and movement patterns needed to 
participate in sports and games involving striking with the lower body.

C3476FC5AE3949ECA8F5F0EEC2A0C58A.description:
Chooses and employs the appropriate motor skills and movement patterns needed to 
participate in sports and games involving striking with the upper body

008DC99CEBEE438B8EAC99B4D304A2B1.description:
Chooses and employs the appropriate motor skills and movement patterns needed to 
participate in sports and games involving throwing and catching.

7D55C887CC4D4094810A8436BE5DE8D9.description:
Chooses and employs the appropriate motor skills and movement patterns needed to 
participate in sports and games involving controlling and using manipulates (balls, pucks, birdies, long implements, short implements, and frisbee discs)

64C6E3887101458D8356B2B0984D16EB.description:
Chooses and employs the appropriate motor skills and movement patterns needed to 
participate in sports and games involving body control and movement in open and personal space.

9F0717EFA2F947BE87E712B5B65D336F.description: The physically educated student demonstrates competency in a variety of motor skills and movement patterns.
